text: Just fix 3 issues in the issue tracker <https://github.com/JuliaSymbolics/Symbolics.jl/issues> before the application and you should be good to go, or make a prototype

elements.text: Just fix 3 issues in the issue tracker
before the application and you should be good to go, or make a prototype

text: Sounds good. I guess writing down all the Rubi rules would also be a necessary benchmark for the project.

elements.text: Sounds good. I guess writing down all the Rubi rules would also be a necessary benchmark for the project.

text: The website also claims they have 72k unit tests for integration... that's a lot of tests.

elements.text: The website also claims they have 72k unit tests for integration... that's a lot of tests.

text: <@U69BL50BF> dumping all those rules and unit tests seems to be quite a parsing feat - if one where to dump them all into huge JSONs, would that be a good start for the application?

elements.text: dumping all those rules and unit tests seems to be quite a parsing feat - if one where to dump them all into huge JSONs, would that be a good start for the application?

text: Just pick a few issues and fix them. That demonstrates you can do the harder ones.

elements.text: Just pick a few issues and fix them. That demonstrates you can do the harder ones.
